what is happening here and why they

just look back at london in april at
that point people were talking about

and mobilize resources for the

and basically it worked it worked we're

is talking about the future and laying

strong growth going forward finishing

change but speaking of the road ahead
why should an American who's out of work

when nobody is buying abroad when our

it hurts us back here in terms of the

and we can't export and that hurts jobs

they will be talking about what policies
are necessary to have balanced
sustainable strong growth going forward
that may require some adjustments by

increased savings for other countries
may mean moving from export-led growth

going forward some countries

particular dollar caps on executive

think president obama and secretary

actions of a forward a number of

and i think is broad agreement broadly

and that's broadly agree there are some

from the US perspective I think the
perspective is that it's important that
the compensation programs themselves
align the right incentives but that
we're not trying to set individual caps
I think the president shared the sense
of outrage about high executive bonuses
by firms that have recently received
public public aid during the
during the crisis but at the same time

have the supervisors have the ability to

that the United States comes to a

all going to get settled at the

the the way the process works is that
they will try and forge international

or around executive compensation and
then it's up to each national authority
to implement that and we're trying to
lay out some specific deadlines for
those actions to be taken and I'm
confident we'll reach broom in those

both through the climate change

not acted as the house has on climate

and dealing with the problems of climate

acts are not correct and in the meantime

we're using all the tools at our

to other things for I let you go on

his part and parcel on keeping the

that was exactly the case with Chinese

has it met for the last time I don't
